intro: Ouratea occultinervis, commonly known as the hidden-vein ouratea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves with concealed venation, giving it its scientific name. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. The fruit is a small capsule that splits open to release its seeds.
